website_summaries.verdict: For just getting the job done without costing a lot of money, the Adorox provides a good value on a home use leather punch.
pros: The handles are comfortable to use
Works on belts and other leather attire
cons: Doesn't include the extra leverage available on some of the more expensive models
It requires more hand strength to use

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: The cutting tool is off center from the anvil making the tool not cut on one side. I also don’t know where the heavy duty is based on if I squeeze to hard you can feel the handle bending. End result is that it takes me about 5min per hole because I have to go from 2 sides and do a lot of twisting and turning to prevent the heavy duty tool to break.
customer_reviews.author: SBlades

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, the punch is not aligned properly with the plate that the leather is pushed against. As a result, it’s impossibls to get a clean hole punch because only half of the hole is actually pushing against something sturdy. The other half just bends the leather and ruins it. Unfortunately I waited a few months after purchasing to use it for the first time and couldn’t return it to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is very difficult to use. I have been unable to make a single button hole with it. It is so hard to use. I have squeezed like a 100 times on it. Don't buy it. I will be returning it $9 aint no joke if it can't do what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.author: Oladunni

customer_reviews.title: I just received this Leather Hole Punch. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Leather Hole Punch. I am hoping that I received what should have been a "reject". None of the six hole punches strike the punch plate completely. None of them are even close. They all miss the punch plate by 50-90%. The tool is heavily made and appears to be quite substantial. It says on the package "Made In China". I am asking this company to send me another tool but only after they inspect it to ensure that all the hole punches strike the punch plate completely. I hope to update this review after I see how this company's customer service works.
customer_reviews.author: Zook

customer_reviews.title: hole puncher
customer_reviews.text: price was good and its sturdiness is great, but not easy to use i couldnt figure out how to use it. i would think its supposed to punch holes in leather belts but there was no way since it had a rubber puncher to make holes made it highly impossible to punch a hole in the canvas fabric i used it for. the price was good and the sturdiness felt like a good heavy tool but as too hole punching i could never know how to punch a hole into the fabric . so i cant say if it works or i just didnt know how to use it unfortuntely .
customer_reviews.author: vanessa gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It’s not useful.
customer_reviews.text: I got it pretty early as it was under prime and that was the only good thing about this product otherwise it’s a complete trash. I don’t know why it’s even claimed sturdy as it’s only 0.04 lb. The metal is totally empty from inside and it’s made of very thin layer of metal. It could barely leave a round mark on the belt. Not useful at all. I am going to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Piyush

customer_reviews.title: It Works but Barely; I'm okay with that
customer_reviews.text: Alright, this was 7 bucks, which is an absolute steal. However, if you're looking for quality, this is not the product. Especially if you're dealing with harder leathers. I was able to punch through all of my belts, but it required a bit of finessing i.e. flipping the belt around so that I could complete the punch through the other side. In a pinch, this works, but don't expect some godly performance.
customer_reviews.author: Dert Tumby

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: I've used it 3 or 4 times and it's worked well. You have to punch it from both sides to get a clean hole and use a peice of wire like a coat hanger to push the punched out peice of leather out of the punch but thats all kind of expected. Seems well made and looks like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: michael p. rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Make this this is what you need, didn't pay close enough attention and got the way wrong thing.
customer_reviews.text: Ended up not being the tool I needed as I should have paid closer attention, was looking for something to put holes in bottle cap keychains.. this puts extra holes in leather belts. Major fail on my part. I'm pretty sure it will work for it's intended purpose though.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great for leather earrings!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great, I was shocked when I opened it and saw how sturdy and heavy duty it was for the price!! I bought it for doing earrings, the smallest setting is the PERFECT size for making the top hole in leather earrings. My husband however has had a belt that he didn’t want to get rid of but was slightly too big, he had no trouble putting a hole in it with this leather punch.
customer_reviews.author: Momto2

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It's very difficult to use. You can't move the tool backwards, you have to go all the way around again and your fingers hurt so much moving it all the way forward.I also noticed when I used the bigger hole size, it would not cut out the entire piece of the belt. Instead, I had to use a smaller hole and then use the bigger one over it. It's very annoying. I'd look for a different hole puncher if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Used hole punch
customer_reviews.text: It appeared to have been used prior. It was already open. It is hard to use I bought it to make holes in cardboard and material. Soo difficult to use. I need to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Fehmee Brathwaite

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to punch holes for a new belt. After the 6th hole the frame bent. Had to buy a new one to complete project.
customer_reviews.author: Mark.Emerson

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for a while but the bit that held the ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a while but the bit that held the wheel in place broke after only a couple weeks. I just bit the bullet and got new shorter belts anyways that are a better fit. Unless you have favorite belts that simply must be adjusted to fit it's probably better in the long run to get new belts.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: Big and sturdy. Works very well. You Have to wiggle it a bit so u can cut thorough. It has a safety lock i thought that was pretty neat as i have a daughter. I am a female between 25-30 yrs old and found this very easy. The shipping was extremely fast. I bought this with my own money. Did not receive this for free.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: It looks ok, but it is really hard to punch a hole on any of my belt! This is my first leather hole puncher, I do not know if other are all so difficult as this one. I do not recommend this one though.
customer_reviews.author: faustin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We have used it on many leathe belts that needed to be made smaller. Easy to use, and much less expense than taking it to a shop to have done. Professional finish Everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Lucretia

customer_reviews.title: Good product, does what it is designed to do
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for punching a hole into a new leather belt. Only drawback was that the yellow plastic covers of the wheel popped off. They are not on securely, but don't interfere with the tool function.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early, only good thing I have to say. The quality is poor, not anything like what is pictured on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Powl

customer_reviews.title: Professional looking!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 10 stars if I could. I used this on a very expensive Louis Vuitton purse strap & I was VERY nervous the holes would be uneven but they look like a professional did them. The tool is very easy to use & didn't require too much strength. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a dollar!
customer_reviews.text: This was a piece of junk. It was so dull and flimsy that it wouldn’t protrude a hole through leather. I immediately returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Quality Lady

customer_reviews.title: Variable size hole punch.
customer_reviews.text: Holes of various sizes and easy to use. I have used it on several different items like thin metal, cardboard, fabric and felt.
customer_reviews.author: Quilt book collector

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, well built, works
customer_reviews.text: It weighs more than you expect. It does punch through leather but you need to use a lot of force. Maybe it's not sharp enough
customer_reviews.author: Rocketsfanforlife

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: They're cheap and work about as good as can be expected. Good thing I'm only punching through very thin plastic
customer_reviews.author: Life in NE WA State

customer_reviews.title: New Holes = EASY PEEZY
customer_reviews.text: I finally have a way to add additional holes to belts without completely destroying the item with a knife. I should have ordered one of these YEARS ago! It's perfect and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: caramelmmt

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I love it use it all the time but kind of hard to use especially trying to punch a hole you have to punch hard
customer_reviews.author: Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: It punches holes in leather. Thin leather. Not recommended for belts. Couldn't punch a hole in my belt using a cheater bar!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Didn't cut leather well. Have to push it over and over in the same spot to get it to cut the material at all
customer_reviews.author: Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Crappy. Literally it’s a pepper hole puncher couldn’t even punch through my thinnest leather strips
customer_reviews.author: Savann

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable tool for leather crafters!
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT. I use it for a lot of leather projects since I do costume work and it makes very clean holes in all the types of leather I've used so far. Definitely test out to see what size you need first on for different thickness. Saves a lot of guess work. Super recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to punch holes with this. I guess it's not sharp enough. I even pressed it while the other side was on the desk and still didn't cut through the belt. I returned mine the next day. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: NeoChase

customer_reviews.title: simple and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the cheapest one on amazon. it's sturdy, simple and does the job. Nothing fancy about it. works great.
customer_reviews.author: Fraka987

customer_reviews.title: Much needed
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very much needed item but it’s a little rough to get holes on leather belt.
customer_reviews.author: mercy

customer_reviews.title: Woks very well
customer_reviews.text: Has easily brought 6 belts back into service. Little training makes it function well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. B

customer_reviews.title: It met my need, Yay!
customer_reviews.text: It did the job 👍 I needed extra holes in my leather belt and this hole puncher met my need,Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Ishopamazon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Start with a small hole and work your way up to larger. Did not cut a clean hole in larger holes sizes without using this process.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This item is great and super handy when adding new or extra holes to leather, i would highly recommend this to others
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable product.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something strong and durable. This is it. Solid materials and well made. Should be the last that I have to buy. Shipped fast, reasonably priced. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: John Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work, would not go through the leather belt at all
customer_reviews.author: Jay Frail

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend it though if you have strong hands and do not mind its sturdy look. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Centeno

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Pressure to punch hole is not excessive. Feels like a quallity tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Roberts

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Bought it because my son is in between sizes and we always need an extra hole. With this tool you can’t tell which holes were made (last one on the belt)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not exactly what it says
customer_reviews.text: only one of the hole works, rest don't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Pk7

customer_reviews.title: ok for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: It punches holes in belts. Not overly complicated and it gets the job done. That being said, I had to bend the mechanism which limits the width in order to slide my belt in.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hacker

customer_reviews.text: Served it's purpose. Wish it was a little sharper though
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey Pharaoh

customer_reviews.title: Good price, hole doesn’t completely punch through or around
customer_reviews.text: Does not punch holes all the way thru or a full circle because the metal punches don’t have even edges. It still works for what I use it for (making journals out of leather), but takes a few punches each hole and I have to use an exacto knife to complete the hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Like others say it doesn't go right through on first punch. I punch a hole then turn it over to get it to go all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to get one of these! Works great. Came on time and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, terrible, terrible
customer_reviews.text: This item is totally worthless.. does not cut Any type of fabric much less leather Waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nina C. Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure my product was used. The packaging was secured with a staple. I didn’t even have to open it the tool just fell out. The tool also looks used.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week.
customer_reviews.text: Broke within a week a receiving. Would not properly puncter a leather belt.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Hard to press but works well! I’ve used mine on belts and bags and I’ve had no problems with it. It’s a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and useless for anything besides thin leather.
customer_reviews.text: Frame bent after about 24 holes! Straightened frame and tried again; died after a few more holes.
customer_reviews.author: Christer Holtze

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price ...feels strong and will last and does it's job

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective!
customer_reviews.text: This has allowed me to continue using belts that I love, whether too big or small! Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Worthy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cousin has and she had no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Annmarie

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I did not like how poor the quality was the 1st and only ti.e I tried to use it . The handle bent when I went to squeeze it to punch the hole

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Fine for the now and the belt adjustment and other leather hole needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done Finally figured out that you push out the part that comes out
customer_reviews.author: Golf what a game

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tool that made my life so much cooler
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tool that made my life so much cooler. I prefer riding with a lot of protection when it comes to motorcycle gloves and with this tool I was able to do a neat and professional perforation job on my dainese gloves. Would definitely recommend and the tool does a great job of cutting a clean hole.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Very good to have for belts that are the wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this will punch holes in so many sizes. I'm losing weight and this has been great for those oversized belts. I've had some purse straps that needed extra holes too.
customer_reviews.author: L  Willis

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily, returned
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item as it broke after punching one hole. I was punching a hole in a leather horse headstall and it bend the little metal clip that is supposed to stop the rotating hole sizes from rotating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: Strong, simple, sharp. Comfortable handles, and locking lever to keep tool closed when not in use. It's well-made, and works exactly as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worth the cost. Won't make a clean cut through very thin leather or a thick leather piece. But loves the middle ground. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Riney

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as described and did the job very neatly!!!
customer_reviews.author: CaliGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good belt hole maker for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good. I do have to make sure the punch is squarely lined up with the plate, or it will not get an even cut. Other than that, it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: I've never used a leather hole puncher before, so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a leather hole puncher before, so I don't know if the sizes are always that difficult to adjust. Otherwise, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: bzbee

customer_reviews.title: Nice leather punch!
customer_reviews.text: Nice leather punch used today on my halter and harness.
customer_reviews.author: Jenene Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: It worked after a hard try
customer_reviews.text: I used this to punch extra holes in a too long belt but it took more strength than I thought iit would

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.. works well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool.. works well.. just remember to clean out the punch

customer_reviews.title: Function is good

customer_reviews.title: Good enough

customer_reviews.text: so useful to the person who needs extra holes in the belt ))

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Punches through heavy leather with ease. Exactly what I was looking for.

customer_reviews.title: then it's fine.
customer_reviews.text: This is very stiff and hard to turn and squeeze if your hands aren't strong; I can make it work but with difficulty and it takes several tries to make a hole. If you have no issues with your hands, then it's fine.

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: This was used on a leather belt I have been unable to wear and this tool worked well

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, but so difficult to make a hole
customer_reviews.text: The holes being made by this equipment are pretty neat and nice. And really affordable too. But one downfall is that it is really hard, for even a man like me, to punch a hole on the belt. I have to use all my power several times to make a hole. Anyways, good product!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect holes for my too big belts
customer_reviews.text: I have over a dozen fashion belts in various color that are too big due to recent weight loss. I was able to save money by not buying new belts. This tool did the trick. Perfect hole sizes!

product_meta.title: Adorox Heavy Duty 6 Size Revolving Leather Belt Hand Hole Puncher
product_meta.description: Color:Red/GrayBrand new high quality 6 size revolving leather belt hole puncher! Perfect for belts, leather, textiles, soft plastics, canvas, etc! Super easy to use.
feature_bullets: Punch after heat. Six head can rotate, the user can adjust according to their own needs.
Great for hobbies, home, arts & crafts, belts, leather, soft plastics, paper card punch holes etc..
